summary: A metropolitan area, or metro, is a region with a big city and smaller nearby towns connected by work, transport, and shared resources. They can be really big, like the New York metro area, which includes Long Island and Manhattan. In the U.S., these areas are officially called metropolitan statistical areas. They are important for the economy and politics. Some metros have one main city, while others, like Dallasâ€“Fort Worth, have multiple big cities.
title: Metropolitan area
